io.netty.handler.codec.http2

Class Http2StreamChannelBootstrap

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.handler.codec.http2.Http2StreamChannelBootstrap

  • @UnstableApi
public class Http2StreamChannelBootstrap
extends Object
    A class that makes it easy to bootstrap a new HTTP/2 stream as a Channel.

    The bootstrap requires a registered parent Channel with a ChannelPipeline that contains the Http2MultiplexCodec.

    A child channel becomes active as soon as it is registered to an eventloop. Therefore, an active channel does not map to an active HTTP/2 stream immediately. Only once a Http2HeadersFrame has been sent or received, does the channel map to an active HTTP/2 stream. In case it was not possible to open a new HTTP/2 stream (i.e. due to the maximum number of active streams being exceeded), the child channel receives an exception indicating the reason and is closed immediately thereafter.

    This class is thread-safe.

      • connect

        public ChannelFuture connect()
        Creates a new channel that will eventually map to a local/outbound HTTP/2 stream.

      • parentChannel

        public Http2StreamChannelBootstrap parentChannel(Channel parent)
        Sets the parent channel that must have the Http2MultiplexCodec in its pipeline.
        Parameters:
        parent - a registered channel with the Http2MultiplexCodec in its pipeline. This channel will be the Channel.parent() of all channels created via connect().
        Returns:
        this

      • handler

        public Http2StreamChannelBootstrap handler(ChannelHandler handler)
        Sets the channel handler that should be added to the channels's pipeline.
        Parameters:
        handler - the channel handler to add to the channel's pipeline. The handler must be ChannelHandler.Sharable.
        Returns:
        this

      • group

        public Http2StreamChannelBootstrap group(EventLoopGroup group)
        Sets the EventLoop to which channels created with this bootstrap are registered.
        Parameters:
        group - the eventloop or null if the eventloop of the parent channel should be used.
        Returns:
        this

      • option

        public <T> Http2StreamChannelBootstrap option(ChannelOption<T> option,
                                              T value)
        Specify ChannelOptions to be set on newly created channels. An option can be removed by specifying a value of null.

        Specify attributes with an initial value to be set on newly created channels. An attribute can be removed by specifying a value of null.
